info.name: Broken Rubix Cube Effect (WIP)
info.description:
WIP
reference: [url]https://twitter.com/Bbbn192/status/1653070539970183168[/url]

how would you properly handle a BSP with sphere marching ? 
Beside, the rotation axis are wrong when more than 1 cut (and only last should turn).

renderpass.code:
#define rot2(a)      mat2(cos(a+vec4(0,11,33,0)))
#define rot(P,A,a) ( mix( A*dot(P,A), P, cos(a) ) + sin(a)*cross(P,A) )
#define H(v)         fract(1e4*sin((v)*(R+71.)))

void mainImage(out vec4 O, vec2 U)
{
    float t=9., T,n = mod(iTime/2.,4.), d, i, c;
    vec3  R = iResolution, N,
          D = normalize(vec3(U+U, -12.*R.y) - R), D2=D,D3, // ray direction
          p = vec3(0,0,20), q,a,                           // marching point along ray 
          M = iMouse.z > 0. ? 6.*iMouse.xyz/R -3.
              :  vec3( 1,.5,0) * cos(.3*iTime + vec3(0,11,0)); 
    D2.yz *= rot2(-M.y),                                   // rotations
    D2.xz *= rot2(-M.x-1.57);
    
    for ( O=vec4(1); O.x > 0. && t > .01; O-=.01 ) {       // march scene
        q = p, 
        q.yz *= rot2(-M.y),                                // rotations
        q.xz *= rot2(-M.x-1.57);
        D3 = D2;
        t = 9.;
        for( i=0.; i++ < n; )
          T = i <= n ? i*2. : (n-(i-1.))*2.,
          d = dot(q, N = normalize(H(i)-.5) ),             // random cut plane
          d>0. ? q = rot(q,N,T) : q,                       // rot half-space
       // t = min(t, abs(d) + .01),                        // slow close to plane for correct stepping through
          c = - d / dot(D3,N),
          c>0. ? t = min(t, c+.01) : t,                    // exact dist along ray
          d>0. ? D3 = rot(D3,N,T) : q;                 
        a = abs(q),
        t = min( t,  c = max(a.x, max(a.y,a.z)) - 1. ),    // cube
        p += .5*t*D;                                       // step forward = dist to obj    
    }
    if (t<.01)                                             // color scheme   
               O = c > 0. 
                    ? p = floor(q+q), t++, 
                      vec4( (.5+.5*mod(p.x+p.y+p.z,2.))    // tiling pattern
                           * dot(vec3(t==a.x,t==a.y,t==a.z), vec3(.9,.7,.5)) ) // shading
                    : vec4(.4,0,0,1);                      // cut part in red
}
